exceptions.tactic: intros p Hp v u H.

exceptions.exn: No such bound variable p (possible names are: n and m).

chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof, without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Sovle This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
p: nat
Hp: p <> 0
v: nat
u: nat

Goal:
v <= u -> 〚 u - v 〛 = 〚 u 〛 ⊕ ∸ 〚 v 〛

Premises:
Inductive nat : Set := O : nat | S : nat -> nat Arguments S _%nat_scope
nat2Zp_plus : forall u v : nat, 〚 u + v 〛 = 〚 u 〛 ⊕ 〚 v 〛
nat2Zp_inj : forall u v : nat, 〚 u 〛 = 〚 v 〛 < -> rem u p = rem v p
nat2Zp_one = Zp_inj 〚 1 〛 Op eq_refl : 〚 1 〛 = Op
nat2Zp_surj : forall u : Z_Zp, {x : nat | x < p /\ u = 〚 x 〛}
nat2Zp_invertible : forall n : nat, Zp_invertible 〚 n 〛 < -> is_gcd p n 1
bezout_generalized_lt : forall p q : nat, 0 < p < q -> {a : nat & {b : nat & {g : nat & {l : nat & {u : nat & {v : nat | a * p + b * q = g + l /\ is_gcd p q g /\ is_lcm p q l /\ p = u * g /\ q = v * g /\ a <= v /\ b <= u}}}}}}
is_lcm_minus : forall p q g l u : nat, p <= q -> p = u * g -> is_gcd p q g -> is_lcm p q l -> is_lcm p (q - p) (l - u * p)
nat2Zp_p = Zp_inj 〚 p 〛 Zp (rem_diag ((fun lemma : p <> 0 <-> Z.of_nat p <> 0%Z => Morphisms.iff_flip_impl_subrelation (p <> 0) (Z.of_nat p <> 0%Z) lemma) (ZifyClasses.not_morph (p = 0) (Z.of_nat p = 0%Z) (ZifyClasses.mkrel nat Z eq Z.of_nat eq (fun x y : nat => iff_sym (Nat2Z.inj_iff x y)) p (Z.of_nat p) eq_refl 0 0%Z eq_refl)) (let Hp0 : Z.of_nat p <> 0%Z := ZifyClasses.rew_iff (p <> 0) (Z.of_nat p <> 0%Z) (ZifyClasses.not_morph (p = 0) (Z.of_nat p = 0%Z) (ZifyClasses.mkrel nat Z eq Z.of_nat eq (fun x y : nat => iff_sym (Nat2Z.inj_iff x y)) p (Z.of_nat p) eq_refl ...
is_lcm_moduplus : forall k p q g l u : nat, p = u * g -> is_gcd p q g -> is_lcm p q l -> is_lcm p (q + k * p) (l + k * u * p)
nat2Zp = fun u : nat => exist (fun x : nat => x < p) (rem u p) (div_rem_spec2 u Hp) : nat -> Z_Zp Arguments nat2Zp _%nat_scope /
mscal_0 : forall (X : Type) (m : X -> X -> X) (u x : X), mscal m u 0 x = u
mk_monoid : forall (X : Type) (m : X -> X -> X) (u : X), (forall x : X, m u x = x) -> (forall x : X, m x u = x) -> (forall x y z : X, m x (m y z) = m (m x y) z) -> monoid_theory m u
mscal_S : forall (X : Type) (m : X -> X -> X) (u : X) (n : nat) (x : X), mscal m u (S n) x = m x (mscal m u n x)
nat2Zp_zero = Zp_inj 〚 0 〛 Zp (rem_prop 0 ((fun lemma : 0 = 0 * p + 0 <-> 0%Z = (0 * Z.of_nat p + 0)%Z => Morphisms.iff_flip_impl_subrelation (0 = 0 * p + 0) (0%Z = (0 * Z.of_nat p + 0)%Z) lemma) (ZifyClasses.mkrel nat Z eq Z.of_nat eq (fun x y : nat => iff_sym (Nat2Z.inj_iff x y)) 0 0%Z eq_refl (0 * p + 0) (0 * Z.of_nat p + 0)%Z (ZifyClasses.mkapp2 nat nat nat Z Init.Nat.add Z.of_nat Z.of_nat Z.of_nat Z.add Nat2Z.inj_add (0 * p) (0 * Z.of_nat p)%Z (ZifyClasses.mkapp2 nat nat nat Z Init.Nat.mul Z.of_nat Z.of_nat Z.of_nat Z.mul Nat2Z.inj_mul 0 0%Z eq_refl p (Z...
Record monoid_theory (X : Type) (m : X -> X -> X) (u : X) : Prop := mk_monoid { monoid_unit_l : forall x : X, m u x = x; monoid_unit_r : forall x : X, m x u = x; monoid_assoc : forall x y z : X, m x (m y z) = m (m x y) z } Arguments monoid_theory [X]%type_scope _%function_scope Arguments mk_monoid [X]%type_scope _%function_scope _ (_ _ _)%function_scope
Zp_opp_plus : forall x y, ∸ (x ⊕ y) = ∸ x ⊕ ∸ y
Nat.add_sub_assoc : forall n m p : nat, p <= m -> n + (m - p) = n + m - p
Nat.pow_sub_r : forall a b c : nat, a <> 0 -> c <= b -> a ^ (b - c) = a ^ b / a ^ c
Zp_opp_plus_eq : forall x y z : Z_Zp, x ⊕ y = z < -> x = z ⊕ ∸ y
Zp_minus : forall x, x ⊕ ∸ x = Zp
Nat2Pos.inj_sub : forall n m : nat, m <> 0 -> Pos.of_nat (n - m) = (Pos.of_nat n - Pos.of_nat m)%positive
is_gcd_minus : forall p q r : nat, p <= q -> is_gcd p q r -> is_gcd p (q - p) r
not_le_minus_0 : forall n m : nat, ~ m <= n -> n - m = 0
Nat.sub_add : forall n m : nat, n <= m -> m - n + n = m
Zp_ring_ring_lemma2 : forall (n : nat) (lH : list (Ring_polynom.PExpr Z * Ring_polynom.PExpr Z)) (l : list Z_Zp), Ring_polynom.interp_PElist Zp Op Zp_plus Zp_mult (fun x y => x ⊕ ∸ y) ∸ eq (gen_phiZ Zp Op Zp_plus Zp_mult ∸) id_phi_N (pow_N Op Zp_mult) l lH ->...-> Ring_polynom.PEeval Zp Op Zp_plus Zp_mult (fun x y => x ⊕ ∸ y) ∸ (gen_phiZ Zp Op Zp_plus Zp_mult ∸) id_phi_N (pow_N Op Zp_mult) l pe = Ring_polynom.Pphi_dev Zp Op Zp_plus Zp_mult (fun x y => x ⊕ ∸ y) ∸ 0%Z 1%Z Zeq_bool (gen_phiZ Zp Op Zp_plus Zp_mult ∸) get_signZ l npe
Zp_opp_inj : forall x y, ∸ x = ∸ y -> x = y
Nat.mod_eq : forall a b : nat, b <> 0 -> a mod b = a - b * (a / b)
Zp_ring_ring_lemma1 : forall (n : nat) (l : list Z_Zp) (lpe : list (Ring_polynom.PExpr Z * Ring_polynom.PExpr Z)) (pe1 pe2 : Ring_polynom.PExpr Z), Ring_polynom.interp_PElist Zp Op Zp_plus Zp_mult (fun x y => x ⊕ ∸ y) ∸ eq (gen_phiZ Zp Op Zp_plus Zp_mult ∸) id_phi_N (pow_N Op Zp_mult) l lpe ->...-> Ring_polynom.PEeval Zp Op Zp_plus Zp_mult (fun x y => x ⊕ ∸ y) ∸ (gen_phiZ Zp Op Zp_plus Zp_mult ∸) id_phi_N (pow_N Op Zp_mult) l pe1 = Ring_polynom.PEeval Zp Op Zp_plus Zp_mult (fun x y => x ⊕ ∸ y) ∸ (gen_phiZ Zp Op Zp_plus Zp_mult ∸) id_phi_N (pow_N Op Zp_mult) l pe2
Nat.add_sub_eq_l : forall n m p : nat, m + p = n -> n - m = p
rem_diag : forall p : nat, p <> 0 -> rem p p = 0
rem_lt : forall p : nat, p <> 0 -> forall a : nat, a < p -> rem a p = a
Zp_plus_inj_l : forall x y z : Z_Zp, x ⊕ y = x ⊕ z -> y = z
Nat.sub_0_le : forall n m : nat, n - m = 0 < -> n <= m
prime = fun p : nat => p <> 1 /\ (forall q : nat, divides q p -> q = 1 \/ q = p) : nat -> Prop Arguments prime _%nat_scope
mult_le_compat : forall n m p q : nat, n <= m -> p <= q -> n * p <= m * q
is_gcd_mult_lcm : forall p q g l : nat, g <> 0 -> is_gcd p q g -> g * l = p * q -> is_lcm p q l
Zp_prime_invert : prime p -> forall x, x <> Zp -> {i : Z_Zp | i ⊗ x = Op}
Nat.mul_sub_distr_l : forall n m p : nat, p * (n - m) = p * n - p * m
Nat.mul_sub_distr_r : forall n m p : nat, (n - m) * p = n * p - m * p
bezout_rel_prime_lt : forall p q : nat, 0 < p < q -> is_gcd p q 1 -> {a : nat & {b : nat | a * p + b * q = 1 + p * q /\ a <= q /\ b <= p}}

``` 
intros p Hp v u H.
intros Hle.
rewrite Nat.sub_add with (n:=u) (m:=v) (p:=v).
rewrite Nat.sub_add.
rewrite nat2Zp_plus.
rewrite nat2Zp_plus.
rewrite Nat.sub_add.
rewrite Nat.sub_add.
rewrite Nat.mod_eq; auto.
rewrite nat2Zp_inj. 
+ rewrite Nat2Pos.inj_sub; auto.
+ apply Nat.sub_0_le in H. auto.
Qed. 
```

original: intros p Hp v u H. intros Hle. rewrite Nat.sub_add with (n:=u) (m:=v) (p:=v). rewrite Nat.sub_add. rewrite nat2Zp_plus. rewrite nat2Zp_plus. rewrite Nat.sub_add. rewrite Nat.sub_add. rewrite Nat.mod_eq; auto. rewrite nat2Zp_inj. + rewrite Nat2Pos.inj_sub; auto. + apply Nat.sub_0_le in H. auto.
